abstract: Orlando, Fla, nightclub shooting is latest black eye for British-based security firm G4S, which employed killer Omar Mateen; company's stock has dropped 6 percent since shooting and it is facing scrutiny over its employment of Mateen for last 9 years.
snippet: The past few years have not gone smoothly for G4S, the giant security firm based in Britain that employed the Orlando nightclub killer, Omar Mateen....
lead_paragraph: The past few years have not gone smoothly for G4S, the giant security firm based in Britain that employed the Orlando nightclub killer, Omar Mateen.

headline.print_headline: Security Firm Gunman Worked For  Has Received Black Eyes Worldwide
headline.main: Gunman’s Employer Dealt Another in a Series of Black Eyes

abstract: Republican Sen Susan Collins of Maine says she is working on compromise gun control bill that will attempt to avoid partisan flash points even as it forbids some terrorism suspects from buying firearms; Collins is trying to avoid type of legislative impasse, in wake of Orlando, Fla, mass shooting, like that following terrorist attack in San Bernardino, Calif.
snippet: Senator Susan Collins of Maine is hoping to break a stalemate by preventing gun sales to a narrower group of terrorism suspects....
lead_paragraph: Senator Susan Collins of Maine is hoping to break a stalemate by preventing gun sales to a narrower group of terrorism suspects.

headline.print_headline: Gun Control Compromise Offered by G.O.P. Senator
headline.main: Spurred by Orlando Shooting, G.O.P. Senator Offers a Gun Control Compromise

abstract: Pres Obama condemns Donald Trump's response to shooting in Orlando, Fla, nightclub and his intimation that all Muslims pose potential terrorist threat; comments mark extraordinary condemnation by sitting president of opposing party's presumptive presidential nominee; Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton follows with her own criticism, as do several Republican leaders.
snippet: The president said Mr. Trump’s remarks after the mass shooting in Orlando, Fla., recalled the most shameful periods in American history....
lead_paragraph: The president said Mr. Trump’s remarks after the mass shooting in Orlando, Fla., recalled the most shameful periods in American history.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

headline.print_headline: Obama Condemns Trump’s Response to Florida Attack
headline.main: Obama Denounces Donald Trump for His ‘Dangerous’ Mind-Set

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and MATT FLEGENHEIMER
byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Washington, and Matt Flegenheimer from Pittsburgh. Reporting was contributed by Amy Chozick, Maggie Haberman and Jonathan Martin from New York, and Emmarie Huetteman from Washington.

abstract: Jordan's government prohibits news media from reporting on shooting at intelligence office near Amman that killed five people, calling violence isolated incident despite suspicions of terrorist attack; experts say Jordan is increasingly vulnerable to extremist attacks due to its high profile role supporting American fight against Islamic State.
snippet: The shooting near Amman raised fears that militants had been able to penetrate one of the region’s most powerful counterterrorism agencies....
lead_paragraph: The shooting near Amman raised fears that militants had been able to penetrate one of the region’s most powerful counterterrorism agencies.

headline.print_headline: Jordan Bars News Media From Reporting on Shooting at Intelligence Office
headline.main: Jordan Bars News Media Coverage of Shooting at Intelligence Office

abstract: United States attorney’s office in Los Angeles files suit to seize payments on life insurance policies of Syed Rizwan Farook, who killed 14 in San Bernadino, Calif, with his wife Tashfeen Malik in 2015 terrorist attack.
snippet: The United States attorney’s office in Los Angeles filed a civil asset forfeiture lawsuit for policies taken out by Syed Rizwan Farook, worth $275,000 in total....
lead_paragraph: The United States attorney’s office in Los Angeles filed a civil asset forfeiture lawsuit for policies taken out by Syed Rizwan Farook, worth $275,000 in total.

headline.print_headline: Government Sues for San Bernardino Gunman’s Life Insurance
headline.main: Government Sues for San Bernardino Gunman’s Life Insurance Policies

abstract: Nigerian schoolgirl Amina Ali, who was among almost 300 girls abducted by militant group during 2014 school raid, is found wandering in forest with her infant daughter; government's campaign to recover captives has garnered criticism, even as military has made progress against militants.
snippet: The girl was wandering in the forest Tuesday when a vigilante group lying in wait to ambush a Boko Haram camp came across her, a commander said....
lead_paragraph: The girl was wandering in the forest Tuesday when a vigilante group lying in wait to ambush a Boko Haram camp came across her, a commander said.

headline.print_headline: Nigerian Schoolgirl Kidnapped by Boko Haram in 2014 Is Found
headline.main: Nigerian Girl Abducted by Boko Haram From Chibok Is Found

byline.original: By CHRIS STEIN and DIONNE SEARCEY

snippet: Human Rights First writes that invoking war powers outside of war “threatens basic human rights.”...
lead_paragraph: Human Rights First writes that invoking war powers outside of war “threatens basic human rights.”

abstract: Supreme Court rules 6-2 that Iran's central bank must pay almost $2 billion to victims of terrorist attacks; cases were brought by relatives of Americans, including those who perished in 1983 Marine Corps barracks bombing in Lebanon.
snippet: A law making it easier for victims’ families to recover damages did not overstep constitutional bounds, the court said....
lead_paragraph: A law making it easier for victims’ families to recover damages did not overstep constitutional bounds, the court said.

headline.print_headline: Justices Rule Victims of Terrorist Attacks May Collect From Iran Central Bank
headline.main: Supreme Court Rules Iran Bank Must Pay for Terrorist Attacks

abstract: Belgian authorities search for Frenchman accused of planning terrorist attack in France; Reda Kriket has long history of criminal convictions and was convicted in absentia in July 2015 by Belgian court for financing Islamic militant activities.
snippet: Reda Kriket, 34, previously convicted of robbery and acts of violence, had amassed an arsenal of weapons and bombs, and on Wednesday he was charged with terrorist conspiracy....
lead_paragraph: Reda Kriket, 34, previously convicted of robbery and acts of violence, had amassed an arsenal of weapons and bombs, and on Wednesday he was charged with terrorist conspiracy.

headline.print_headline: Belgium Seeks Leads on Frenchman Accused of Plot
headline.main: Investigators Pursue Leads on Frenchman Accused of Terror Plot

byline.contributor: Neil Collier contributed reporting from Brussels.

abstract: Belgian authorities admit mistakes in lead-up to Brussels terrorist attacks, as information linking Brussels and Paris attacks continues to emerge; admitted lapses include failure to act on Turkish alert about one of suspects and to share information that may have helped penetrate Islamic State-related extremist network taking root in Europe.
snippet: The justice and interior ministers said officials might have been lax in passing along information about a terrorism suspect and offered to resign....
lead_paragraph: The justice and interior ministers said officials might have been lax in passing along information about a terrorism suspect and offered to resign.

headline.print_headline: Belgium Admits Lapses Before Brussels Attacks
headline.main: Brussels Attack Lapses Acknowledged by Belgian Officials

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Brussels, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Reporting was contributed by Lilia Blaise and Aurelien Breeden from Brussels, Milan Schreuer from Paris, Sewell Chan from London and Rukmini Callimachi from New York.
